solution_line_template: Each of Koby's boxes contain {koby_sparklers_per_box} sparklers + {koby_whistlers_per_box} whistlers = <<{koby_sparklers_per_box}+{koby_whistlers_per_box}={koby_fireworks_per_box}>>{koby_fireworks_per_box} fireworks.
So in total, Koby has {koby_num_boxes} boxes * {koby_fireworks_per_box} fireworks per box = <<{koby_num_boxes}*{koby_fireworks_per_box}={koby_total_fireworks}>>{koby_total_fireworks} fireworks.

Cherie's box of fireworks has {cherie_sparklers_per_box} sparklers + {cherie_whistlers_per_box} whistlers = <<{cherie_sparklers_per_box}+{cherie_whistlers_per_box}={cherie_fireworks_per_box}>>{cherie_fireworks_per_box} fireworks.

Koby and Cherie therefore have a combined total of {koby_total_fireworks} fireworks from Koby + {cherie_fireworks_per_box} fireworks from Cherie = <<{koby_total_fireworks}+{cherie_fireworks_per_box}={total_fireworks}>>{total_fireworks} fireworks.
